channel.title: Back up!
channel.description:
Still at the datacenter in cincinnati, but everything appears to be back up and running better than ever.
I'm tired and still haven't ate since last night about 6pm (it's 5pm now), so hopefully everything goes good on the drive home and I get to rest.

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:37, topic:276849”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=365511.msg2775661#msg2775661 date=1241503070]

And when you’re getting mugged in a dark ally?

jme was saying that it would probably reduce crime and used shoplifting and home breakins as an example where it would. I’m not disputing that some gun laws reduce crime (although my opinion is that no one except police officers should carry a firearm). I’m disputing the example that jme gave.
[/quote]

If you own a concealed gun permit, then you also own a gun at home… I guess it was a poor example. My point was anyways, more gun owning law-abiding citizens means more deterrence for crime. Concealed gun permit statistics I guess are one more way to show criminals that people do have guns and will fight back. [/quote]
Acording to this site: http://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSL2834893820070828 it is 9 guns per 10 people.
And the crimerate is high, so how can that be rigth, lots of guns AND lots of crime.

Read full topic

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:29, topic:276849”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=365511.msg2775420#msg2775420 date=1241487280]
And when you’re getting mugged in a dark ally?
[/quote]
jme was saying that it would probably reduce crime and used shoplifting and home breakins as an example where it would. I’m not disputing that some gun laws reduce crime (although my opinion is that no one except police officers should carry a firearm). I’m disputing the example that jme gave.[/quote]

If you own a concealed gun permit, then you also own a gun at home… I guess it was a poor example. My point was anyways, more gun owning law-abiding citizens means more deterrence for crime. Concealed gun permit statistics I guess are one more way to show criminals that people do have guns and will fight back.

Read full topic

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Wrauld:

Gun laws should be passed every where. If only police officers were to carry guns, then the crime rate will at least double. Mexicans can smuggle guns over the borders, etc,.

Strange, how can the crime rate then be much higher than many European countries with less punishment, stricter gun laws and better prisons?

Read full topic

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Kennesaw, Georgia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kennesaw,_Georgia#Gun_law

House burglaries dropped by 89% when they passed a law requiring every house to have a gun and ammunition. As jme said, no one in their right mind is going to rob a house there.

Read full topic

item.description:

There is a place in america where you have to have a gun, and the crime rate there is minimal

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:29, topic:276849”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=365511.msg2775420#msg2775420 date=1241487280]
And when you’re getting mugged in a dark ally?
[/quote]
jme was saying that it would probably reduce crime and used shoplifting and home breakins as an example where it would. I’m not disputing that some gun laws reduce crime (although my opinion is that no one except police officers should carry a firearm). I’m disputing the example that jme gave.[/quote]

Well the example he gave is still valid if it’s a shop, if someone’s robbing you at point blank range with a gun, you’re not going to have time to reach for your gun without him noticing, but when other people may have guns, they can easily get their gun out while his back is turned.

Read full topic

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:25, topic:276849”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=365511.msg2775363#msg2775363 date=1241484957]

That might be part of the strategy to reducing crime… I wouldn’t rob a store if people had guns on them. I wouldn’t take the risk of breaking into a home if they owned guns…

Defend a store or a home? You don’t need to have a concealed gun permit for that. The shop keeper can hide one under his till and the home owner can put it on his bedside table. Your average home owner isn’t going to wear their gun to bed so being able to carry it on you is pointless.
[/quote]
And when you’re getting mugged in a dark ally?[/quote]

Then they wouldn’t be your ally then, would they?

Read full topic

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:18, topic:276849”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=365511.msg2774604#msg2774604 date=1241459386]
No, because I, like 142,732 other people in my state of ohio,
[/quote]
Jeez, how do you get such an exact number?[/quote]

http://www.ag.state.oh.us/le/prevention/concealcarry/docs/08_cc_annual_rpt.pdf

The 2008 annual report said it.

And what jme said is the exact reason gun control doesn’t work, gun laws only disarm law-abiding citizens, and when law-abiding citizens are disarmed, criminals know they are free to do whatever they want with their guns.

Read full topic

item.title: Back up!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:16, topic:276849”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=365511.msg2774421#msg2774421 date=1241447234]

Fuckers didn’t bother to press the power button to turn in back on last night after they worked on the rack, had to call them just now to get them to do it.

This data center blows…

Woah… been here almost 3 year’s and thts the first time ive seen you swear

How would you feel if you travelled an entire day, didn’t eat, and they still fuck it up?

So pissed I’d use my extensive gun collection with redneck intentions.

He actually took his gun if I understood him correctly on IRC. ;D

I did, but I take my gun everywhere.
[/quote]

isn’t that illiegal?[/quote]

No, because I, like 142,732 other people in my state of ohio, have a concealed carry permit. This allows us to carry a concealed gun with us everywhere we go except certain places prohibited by law. (post offices, other government buildings etc) Since this law was passed in 2005, crime has dropped steadily. For more info, look into the gun control thread.

Read full topic
